pullRequest.body:
The original `EllipticCurve` is `WeierstrassCurve` bundled with `Δ' : Rˣ` and a proof that `Δ' = Δ`. This definition makes `Δ'` and `j` computable, but at the expense that some APIs must be duplicated for `EllipticCurve` and `WeierstrassCurve`.

This PR adds the typeclass `WeierstrassCurve.IsElliptic` which asserts that `IsUnit W.Δ`, and which is a `Prop`. The old API for elliptic curves are replaced by a `WeierstrassCurve` `W` together with `[W.IsElliptic]`. The caveat is that `Δ'` and `j` becomes noncomputable.

The original design of this PR is `WeierstrassCurve.Elliptic` which is `Invertible W.Δ`, and which is a `Type`. By this design `Δ'` and `j` remain computable. But this design makes simpNF linter timeout. So this design is abandoned and replaced by current design.

---

`+ twoTorsionPolynomial_disc_ne_zero_of_isElliptic`
`+ variableChange_Δ'`
`+ Δ'`
`+-- twoTorsionPolynomial_disc_ne_zero`
`- EllipticCurve`
`- EllipticCurve.toAffine`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.exists_variableChange_isCharNeTwoNF`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.exists_variableChange_isCharThreeNF`

`- _root_.EllipticCurve.exists_variableChange_isShortNF`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.j_ne_zero_of_isCharThreeJNeZeroNF_of_char_three`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.j_ne_zero_of_isCharTwoJNeZeroNF_of_char_two`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.j_of_isCharThreeJNeZeroNF_of_char_three`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.j_of_isCharTwoJEqZeroNF`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.j_of_isCharTwoJEqZeroNF_of_char_two`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.j_of_isCharTwoJNeZeroNF_of_char_two`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.j_of_isShortNF`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.j_of_isShortNF_of_char_three`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.toCharThreeNF_spec_of_b₂_eq_zero`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.toCharThreeNF_spec_of_b₂_ne_zero`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.toCharTwoJEqZeroNF_spec`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.toCharTwoJNeZeroNF_spec`
`- _root_.EllipticCurve.toShortNFOfCharThree_spec`
`- baseChange`
`- ext`
`- instInhabitedEllipticCurve`
`- instMulActionVariableChange`
`- instance _root_.EllipticCurve.toCharNeTwoNF_spec :`
`- instance _root_.EllipticCurve.toCharThreeNF_spec :`
`- instance _root_.EllipticCurve.toCharTwoNF_spec [DecidableEq F] :`
`- instance _root_.EllipticCurve.toShortNF_spec : (E.variableChange E.toShortNF).IsShortNF`
`- map`
`- map_injective`
`- ofJ'`
`- ofJ'_j`
`- ofJ0`
`- ofJ1728`
`- ofJ_c₄`
`- ofJ_Δ`
`- toWeierstrassCurve_injective`
`- variableChange`
`- variableChange_comp`
`- variableChange_id`
`-+- ofJ`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

I've tested that `Elliptic : Type` -> `IsElliptic : Prop` and which eliminates the mysterious timeout error. At the expense that `Δ'` and `j` being noncomputable...

Note that the `Invertible` instance is still used, which contains data... Next step maybe we want to replaced them by `IsUnit` which contains no data, but for now `IsUnit` is not an instance... so I think this is related to #17458 ...

pullRequest.title: refactor(AlgebraicGeometry/EllipticCurve/*): add `WeierstrassCurve.IsElliptic` and remove `EllipticCurve`
